item.title: [HBASE-1645] HBase could be a little more dainty when zk is pulled out from under it

You then have to do killjava -9 to get it to go down.

Here is related mail: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hadoop-zookeeper-user/200906.mbox/%3C31a243e70906231232h51c6abfdr2e3265f8e81f6f41@mail.gmail.com%3E

This is not a biggy. Just noting it. No ZK, no HB.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Try the static method call:

HConnectionManager.deleteAllConnections(true);

Worked for me.
I think this is fixed by HBASE-5682
There has been progress on this elsewhere. Reopen if needed.
+1 for use of "dainty" in a JIRA subject, tho.
